oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Radio for the whole family
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Classified ad for Christmas gift suggestions, Nashville Tennessean, page A8

During the 1920s, radios began to be mass produced and they became accessible to a wide audience. Through the radio, people could listen to a variety of programming such as news, comedy, and drama. The radio also allowed listeners to hear different types of music such as jazz, blues, opera, and country.
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: Radio; Broadcasting; Advertising
